quotes.quote: Strangers are endearing because you don't know them yet.
When immigrants go into the worse neighborhood and they fix it up, they should become citizens.
Stranger, here you will do well to tarry; here our highest good is pleasure.
Immigrants are going back where they came. If they came from a certain country, they are going to be brought back to their country. That's the way it's supposed to be
A stranger is someone with whom you feel strange.
He felt like an outsider. He felt angry, and he felt his brilliance was being overlooked. And he felt much smarter than the people around him.
The feeling of being an outsider, and the identity theme, are hardwired into me. If there's anything really autobiographical in my fiction, it's that feeling. I always feel that way.
In a sea of strangers, you've longed to know me. Your life spent sailing to my shores.
Outsiders often have an insight that an insider doesn't quite have.

When you're an outsider, you don't have loyalties to anyone, so you can be cruelly honest if need be. The more you get inside, the more you are involved in polite networks of professional coercion that make people less honest.
An outsider's point of view is always handy.
Each stranger is like an unexplored continent whose depths you want to explore before you plant your flag in his heart.
Strangers take a long time to become acquainted, particularly when they are from the same family.
Being an outsider is the one thing we all have in common.
Outsider. You do what you want, say what you want, and move on when you've worn out your welcome.
For immigrant generations especially, family is the first structure, or shelter, for a people who are in exile
No matter where you are, you're always a bit on your own, always an outsider.
An outsider can see some things much better.
Immigrant: An unenlightened person who thinks one country better than another.
Outsider means I will accept the possibility that I don't have responsibility for what is happening inside my domain.
